briefTitle: Safety and Efficacy Study of Sublingual Immunotherapy (SLIT) to Treat House Dust Mite Allergic Rhinitis
officialTitle: A Randomized, DBPC, Multi-national Phase II/III Study of the Safety and Efficacy of Two Doses of Sublingual Immunotherapy (SLIT) Administered as Allergen-based Tablets Once Daily to Adult Patients Suffering From HDM Allergic Rhinitis

interventions.name: 300 IR house dust mites allergen extract tablet
500 IR house dust mites allergen extract tablet

summary: The purpose of this study is to assess the efficacy of two doses of sublingual immunotherapy (SLIT) administered as allergen-based tablets once daily over a period of 12 months compared to placebo, for reduction of allergic rhinitis symptoms and rescue medication usage

primaryOutcome.measure: Average Adjusted Symptom Score (AAdSS) During the Year 1 Primary Period
